# LEGO RGB LED Clock kits

<div style="clear:both;display:block">
<blockquote class="twitter-video" data-lang="en"><p lang="en" dir="ltr"><a href="https://twitter.com/hackadayio">@HackadayIo</a> <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/WeekendHack?src=hash">#WeekendHack</a> upgraded daughter's LEGO Unary Clock to RGB. (vid shows change from 1:59 to 2:00pm) <a href="https://t.co/ojjwGGoM4l">pic.twitter.com/ojjwGGoM4l</a></p>- Shrimping It (@ShrimpingIt) <a href="https://twitter.com/ShrimpingIt/status/727121986414071808">May 2, 2016</a></blockquote>
</div>

This is a bagged kit of the project-specific components to build a @ShrimpingIt LEGO RGB Unary Clock, as [featured on Hackaday](http://hackaday.com/2016/05/14/unary-clock-for-the-binary-challenged/).

## Sourcing Kits and Bundles <a id="bom"></a>

The component and wholesaler information for this project are linked below. Click the ***Add To Cart*** button above for pre-bagged kits from our [retail bagging service](../kit/) to avoid the hassle of self-sourcing.

Our £28.50 ***LEGO RGB LED Clock Addon*** includes...

* 25 Chained, Neopixel-Compatible, [5mm PL9823 Addressable RGB LEDs](http://www.aliexpress.com/snapshot/7642398983.html?orderId=75034366259252)
* 24pcs Technic LEGO-compatible 1x1 bricks with 5mm hole (LED housings)
* 24pcs Transparent LEGO-compatible 1x1 Round Plates (LED covers)
* Several 8x1 and 6x1 Black LEGO-compatible Bricks
* Several 8x2 and 8x6 Black LEGO-compatible Rectangular Plates
* A hand-crimped USB Male-A to breadboard 5V power cable
* A [5V 1A USB mains adaptor plug](http://www.aliexpress.com/snapshot/7778752102.html?orderId=75983443659252)

Our £40.00 ***Bundle*** includes.

* This LEGO RGB LED Clock Addon kit
* An [Alarm Clock Addon](alarmclock.html) kit
* A [Shrimp Parts](shrimp.html) kit
* A [400-point breadboard](breadboard400.html)
* A [USB UART](cp2102.html) kit

See the [pathways map](/#kit) for a pricing breakdown and to find accessories to build other [@ShrimpingIt projects](/#project) reusing the same components.
